# Business Process Framework

A modern, comprehensive business process management application built with Laravel 12, Inertia.js, React, and TypeScript. This application helps organizations map, visualize, and manage their business processes using the RACI responsibility matrix framework.

![Laravel](https://img.shields.io/badge/Laravel-12-FF2D20?style=flat&logo=laravel&logoColor=white)
![React](https://img.shields.io/badge/React-19-61DAFB?style=flat&logo=react&logoColor=black)
![TypeScript](https://img.shields.io/badge/TypeScript-5.7-3178C6?style=flat&logo=typescript&logoColor=white)
![Inertia.js](https://img.shields.io/badge/Inertia.js-2.0-9553E9?style=flat&logo=inertia&logoColor=white)

## ‚ú® Features

### üéØ Core Functionality
- **Process Categories**: Organize processes into Strategic Planning Layer, Core Value Chain, and Enabling Processes
- **RACI Matrix Management**: Define responsibilities using Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed framework
- **Process Diagrams**: Create and manage visual process diagrams with activities
- **Mermaid Integration**: Import/export process diagrams using Mermaid syntax
- **Drag & Drop**: Intuitive activity reordering with real-time position updates
- **Real-time Updates**: Seamless data synchronization without page reloads

### üé® User Experience
- **Modern UI**: Built with shadcn/ui components and Tailwind CSS
- **Dark Mode Support**: Complete theme switching capability
- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-first approach with optimal tablet and desktop experiences
- **Toast Notifications**: Real-time feedback for user actions
- **Breadcrumb Navigation**: Intuitive navigation with category-aware breadcrumbs
- **Pagination**: Efficient data handling for large datasets

### üîí Security & Performance
- **Authentication**: Secure user authentication and session management
- **Authorization**: Policy-based access control for all resources
- **User Isolation**: Each user sees only their own diagrams and activities
- **Input Validation**: Comprehensive server and client-side validation
- **Performance Optimized**: Efficient queries and state management

## üõ† Tech Stack

### Backend
- **Laravel 12** - Modern PHP framework
- **Inertia.js 2.0** - Server-side rendering with SPA experience
- **PHP 8.2+** - Latest PHP features and performance
- **SQLite/MySQL** - Flexible database options

### Frontend
- **React 19** - Latest React with concurrent features
- **TypeScript 5.7** - Type-safe development
- **Tailwind CSS 4.0** - Utility-first CSS framework
- **shadcn/ui** - High-quality component library
- **Lucide React** - Beautiful icon library

### Development Tools
- **Vite 6.0** - Fast build tool and dev server
- **ESLint 9** - Code linting and formatting
- **Prettier 3** - Code formatting
- **Jest** - Frontend testing framework
- **PHPUnit** - Backend testing framework

### Key Libraries
- **@dnd-kit** - Drag and drop functionality
- **Mermaid** - Diagram generation and parsing
- **Sonner** - Toast notifications
- **Vaul** - Drawer components for mobile

## üöÄ Quick Start

### Prerequisites
- PHP 8.2 or higher
- Node.js 18 or higher
- Composer 2.x
- pnpm (recommended) or npm

### Installation

1. **Clone the repository**
   ```bash
   git clone <repository-url>
   cd business-process
   ```

2. **Install PHP dependencies**
   ```bash
   composer install
   ```

3. **Install Node.js dependencies**
   ```bash
   pnpm install
   # or
   npm install
   ```

4. **Environment setup**
   ```bash
   cp .env.example .env
   php artisan key:generate
   ```

5. **Database setup**
   ```bash
   # For SQLite (default)
   touch database/database.sqlite

   # Run migrations and seeders
   php artisan migrate --seed
   ```

6. **Email Configuration (Resend)**
   ```bash
   # Add to your .env file
   MAIL_MAILER=resend
   MAIL_FROM_ADDRESS=your-email@yourdomain.com
   MAIL_FROM_NAME="Your App Name"
   RESEND_KEY=your_resend_api_key_here
   ```

7. **Build assets**
   ```bash
   pnpm run build
   # or for development
   pnpm run dev
   ```

8. **Start the development server**
   ```bash
   # Using composer script (recommended)
   composer run dev

   # Or manually
   php artisan serve
   ```

Visit `http://localhost:8000` to access the application.

## üîß Development

### Development Commands

```bash
# Start all development services (server, queue, logs, vite)
composer run dev

# Run with SSR
composer run dev:ssr

# Frontend development
pnpm run dev          # Start Vite dev server
pnpm run build        # Build for production
pnpm run lint         # Lint code
pnpm run format       # Format code with Prettier
pnpm run types        # Type checking

# Backend development
php artisan serve     # Start Laravel server
php artisan tinker    # Interactive shell
php artisan migrate   # Run migrations
php artisan test      # Run tests
```

### Code Quality

```bash
# Laravel Pint (PHP formatting)
./vendor/bin/pint

# ESLint (JavaScript/TypeScript)
pnpm run lint

# Prettier (Code formatting)
pnpm run format

# Type checking
pnpm run types
```

## üß™ Testing

### Comprehensive Test Suite
The application includes a complete test suite covering:
- **Unit Tests**: Model logic and policies
- **Feature Tests**: Controller and integration testing
- **Browser Tests**: End-to-end workflows
- **Frontend Tests**: React component testing

### Running Tests

```bash
# Backend tests
php artisan test                    # All tests
php artisan test --coverage        # With coverage
php artisan test --testsuite=Unit  # Unit tests only
php artisan test --testsuite=Feature # Feature tests only

# Frontend tests
pnpm run test              # Run Jest tests
pnpm run test:watch        # Watch mode
pnpm run test:coverage     # With coverage
pnpm run test:ci          # CI mode
```

### Test Coverage
- **90%+ Backend Coverage**: All critical paths tested
- **100% Authorization Coverage**: All policies and permissions
- **Complete CRUD Coverage**: All operations tested
- **Frontend Component Coverage**: Key components tested

## üìÅ Project Structure

```
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ app/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Http/Controllers/     # Laravel controllers
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Models/              # Eloquent models
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Policies/            # Authorization policies
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Providers/           # Service providers
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ database/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ factories/           # Model factories
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ migrations/          # Database migrations
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ seeders/            # Database seeders
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ resources/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ js/
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ components/      # React components
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ layouts/         # Layout components
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ pages/          # Page components
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ hooks/          # Custom hooks
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ types/          # TypeScript types
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ views/              # Blade templates
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ routes/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ web.php             # Web routes
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ auth.php            # Authentication routes
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tests/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Feature/            # Feature tests
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Unit/              # Unit tests
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Browser/           # Browser tests
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ public/                # Public assets
```

## üóÉ Database Schema

### Core Models
- **Categories**: Process categorization (Strategic, Core, Enabling)
- **Processes**: Individual business processes
- **Diagrams**: Process visualization and documentation
- **Activities**: Individual process steps with RACI assignments
- **Users**: Application users with authentication

### Key Relationships
```
Category ‚Üí Process ‚Üí Diagram ‚Üí Activity
                        ‚Üì
                      User (owner)
```

## üîê Authentication & Authorization

### Authentication
- Laravel Breeze integration
- Session-based authentication
- Secure password hashing
- Remember me functionality

### Authorization
- Policy-based access control
- User ownership validation
- Resource-level permissions
- Route protection middleware

## üì± Responsive Design

The application is fully responsive with:
- **Mobile-first approach** (320px+)
- **Tablet optimization** (768px+)
- **Desktop enhancement** (1024px+)
- **Large screen support** (1536px+)

### Mobile Features
- Drawer navigation
- Touch-friendly interactions
- Optimized layouts
- Swipe gestures

## üé® UI Components

### Design System
- **shadcn/ui components**: High-quality, accessible components
- **Tailwind CSS**: Utility-first styling
- **Consistent theming**: Light and dark mode support
- **Icon system**: Lucide React icons throughout

### Key Components
- **Cards**: Process and activity display
- **Tables**: RACI matrix with inline editing
- **Modals/Drawers**: Responsive dialogs
- **Forms**: Validated input components
- **Navigation**: Breadcrumbs and sidebar

## üöÄ Deployment

### Production Build
```bash
# Install dependencies
composer install --optimize-autoloader --no-dev
pnpm install

# Build assets
pnpm run build

# Optimize Laravel
php artisan config:cache
php artisan route:cache
php artisan view:cache
```

### Environment Variables
Configure your `.env` file for production:
```env
APP_ENV=production
APP_DEBUG=false
APP_URL=https://your-domain.com

# Database configuration
DB_CONNECTION=mysql
DB_HOST=127.0.0.1
DB_PORT=3306
DB_DATABASE=your_database
DB_USERNAME=your_username

```

## ü§ù Contributing

2. Create a feature branch (`git checkout -b feature/amazing-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -m 'Add amazing feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin feature/amazing-feature`)
5. Open a Pull Request

### Code Standards
- Follow PSR-12 for PHP code
- Use Prettier/ESLint for JavaScript/TypeScript
- Write tests for new features
- Update documentation as needed

### Pull Request Guidelines
- Include tests for new functionality
- Ensure all tests pass
- Update README if needed
- Follow the existing code style
- Write clear commit messages

## üìÑ License

This project is open-sourced software licensed under the [MIT license](LICENSE).

## üÜò Support

### Documentation
- [Laravel Documentation](https://laravel.com/docs)
- [Inertia.js Documentation](https://inertiajs.com)
- [React Documentation](https://react.dev)
- [shadcn/ui Documentation](https://ui.shadcn.com)

### Getting Help
- Check the [Issues](https://github.com/your-repo/issues) page
- Review the test suite for examples
- Read the inline code documentation

# BVT (Business Valuation Tool) - Current Features Analysis

## Project Overview
The BVT project is a React-based business valuation tool built with Vite, designed to assess businesses through comprehensive multi-step assessments. It integrates with Supabase for authentication and data storage, and uses modern React patterns with routing and state management.

## Core Technologies & Dependencies
- **Frontend Framework**: React 19.0.0 with Vite 6.2.0
- **Routing**: React Router DOM 7.5.1
- **Authentication**: Supabase 2.49.4
- **Database**: Supabase (PostgreSQL)
- **Charts/Visualization**: Recharts 2.15.2
- **PDF Generation**: @react-pdf/renderer 4.3.0
- **Email Service**: Resend 4.2.0
- **Number Formatting**: react-number-format 5.4.4
- **Image Capture**: html-to-image 1.11.13

## 1. Authentication System

### Features:
- **User Registration/Signup** (`SignupForm.jsx`)
  - Email and password-based registration
  - Integration with Supabase authentication
  - Form validation and error handling

- **User Login** (`LoginForm.jsx`)
  - Email/password authentication
  - Remember me functionality
  - Password reset capabilities

- **Protected Routes** (`ProtectedRoute.jsx`)
  - Route protection based on authentication status
  - Automatic redirect to login for unauthenticated users

- **Session Management**
  - Automatic session handling with Supabase
  - Logout functionality with proper cleanup
  - Auth state persistence across sessions

### Technical Implementation:
- Supabase Context Provider for global auth state
- JWT token management
- Session persistence and restoration

## 2. Business Assessment Engine

### Core Assessment Structure:
The system implements a comprehensive 13-step business evaluation process:

1. **Your Profile** - Basic business information
2. **Sale to Delivery Process Assessment** (S2D)
3. **Delivery to Success Assessment** (D2S)
4. **Market to Lead - Channels & Economics** (M2L Part 1)
5. **Market to Lead - Process Assessment** (M2L Part 2)
6. **Expansion Capability**
7. **Marketing & Brand Equity**
8. **Profitability Metrics**
9. **Offering & Sales Effectiveness**
10. **Workforce & Leadership**
11. **Execution Systems**
12. **Robust Market Position**
13. **Your Financials & Industry**

### 2.1 Multi-Step Form System (`MultiStepForm.jsx`)

**Features:**
- **Progress Tracking**: Visual progress indicator showing current step
- **Form State Persistence**: Local storage backup of form data
- **Navigation**: Forward/backward navigation with validation
- **Conditional Logic**: Questions adapt based on previous answers
- **Real-time Validation**: Immediate feedback on form inputs
- **Section Results**: Detailed scoring and analysis per section

**Technical Implementation:**
- Complex state management with React hooks
- Form data persistence using localStorage
- Dynamic question rendering based on section
- Integration with scoring algorithms

### 2.2 Sale to Delivery Process Assessment (S2D)

**Features:**
- **Product/Service Specific Assessments**: Evaluate individual offerings
- **Process Maturity Scoring**: 8 key process areas evaluation
- **Owner Independence Analysis**: Measure business dependence on owner
- **Detailed Scoring System**:
  - Process maturity scores (0-7 scale)
  - Owner involvement scores (0-5 scale)
  - Client Experience Optimization scoring
  - Resource Allocation Effectiveness scoring

**Assessment Areas:**
1. Contract and Payment Processing
2. Internal Handoff from Sales to Delivery Team
3. Client Onboarding Process
4. Asset and Information Collection
5. Expectation Setting, Timeline and Success Metrics
6. Scheduling and Resource Allocation
7. Client Communication Plan
8. Quality Assurance and Delivery

**Technical Implementation:**
- Modular question structure in `saleToDeliveryQuestions.js`
- Dynamic scoring algorithms
- Industry-specific question context
- Results visualization and interpretation

### 2.3 Market to Lead Assessment (M2L)

**Features:**
- **Two-Part Assessment**: Separate channels/economics and process evaluation
- **Marketing Channel Analysis**: Detailed evaluation of marketing effectiveness
- **Lead Generation Metrics**: ROI and cost-per-lead analysis
- **Channel-Specific Questions**: Dynamic questions based on primary marketing channel

**Supported Marketing Channels:**
- Digital Marketing
- Direct Sales
- Referrals & Word of Mouth
- Content Marketing
- Social Media
- Events & Trade Shows
- Partnerships
- Traditional Advertising

### 2.4 Delivery to Success Assessment (D2S)

**Features:**
- Post-delivery success measurement
- Customer satisfaction tracking
- Long-term relationship management
- Success metrics definition and tracking

## 3. Scoring and Valuation System

### 3.1 Scoring Areas (`scoringAreas.js`)
- **Expansion Capability**
- **Marketing & Brand Equity**
- **Profitability Metrics**
- **Offering & Sales Effectiveness**
- **Workforce & Leadership**
- **Execution Systems**
- **Robust Market Position**

### 3.2 Valuation Calculation
- **EBITDA-based Valuation**: Multiple-based business valuation
- **Industry Adjustments**: NAICS code-based industry factors
- **Tier-based Multipliers**: Different multipliers based on business maturity
- **Qualitative Score Integration**: Assessment scores influence valuation

**EBITDA Tiers:**
- Startup: $0 - $500k (2.0-3.0x multiplier)
- Mature Start-up: $500k - $1M (2.5-3.5x multiplier)
- Grow-up: $1M - $1.5M (3.0-4.5x multiplier)
- Mature Grow-up: $1.5M - $2M (3.5-5.0x multiplier)
- Scale Up: $2M - $3M (4.0-5.5x multiplier)
- Mature Scaleup: $3M+ (4.5-6.5x multiplier)

## 4. Results and Reporting System

### 4.1 Results Display (`ResultsDisplay.jsx`)
- **Comprehensive Valuation Report**: Complete business valuation with breakdown
- **Scoring Analysis**: Detailed scoring across all assessment areas
- **Visual Charts**: Recharts-based visualization of scores and metrics
- **Downloadable Reports**: Text and PDF export capabilities

### 4.2 Section Results (`SectionResultsPage.jsx`)
- **Individual Section Analysis**: Detailed scoring for specific assessment sections
- **Question-by-Question Breakdown**: Review of all answers and scores
- **Improvement Recommendations**: Actionable insights based on scores

### 4.3 S2D Specific Results (`S2DResultsDisplayPage.jsx`)
- **Product/Service Specific Reports**: Dedicated S2D assessment results
- **Process Maturity Analysis**: Detailed breakdown of process scores
- **Owner Independence Metrics**: Business dependence analysis
- **Interpretation Guidelines**: Score interpretation and recommendations

## 5. Data Management

### 5.1 NAICS Industry Classification
- **Industry Selection**: Comprehensive NAICS code integration
- **Sector and Subsector**: Hierarchical industry classification
- **Industry-Specific Adjustments**: Valuation factors based on industry

### 5.2 Form Data Persistence
- **Local Storage Integration**: Form state preservation across sessions
- **Assessment Continuation**: Resume incomplete assessments
- **Data Recovery**: Automatic restoration of form progress

### 5.3 Backend Integration
- **Supabase Database**: Assessment data storage
- **User Data Management**: Secure user information storage
- **Assessment History**: Track multiple assessments per user

## 6. User Experience Features

### 6.1 Navigation System (`Navigation.jsx`)
- **Multi-step Navigation**: Forward/backward navigation with validation
- **Progress Tracking**: Visual indication of assessment progress
- **Section Jumping**: Direct navigation to specific sections (when allowed)

### 6.2 Question System (`Step.jsx`)
- **Dynamic Question Rendering**: Adaptive question display based on type
- **Input Validation**: Real-time validation with error messages
- **Help Text**: Contextual help and explanations
- **Industry Context**: Industry-specific question guidance

### 6.3 Home Page Guard (`HomePageGuard.jsx`)
- **Assessment Status Detection**: Check for existing assessments
- **Continue/Restart Options**: Resume or start new assessments
- **User Guidance**: Clear instructions for assessment process

## 7. Product/Service Management

### 7.1 Add Product/Service Page (`AddProductServicePage.jsx`)
- **New S2D Assessments**: Create assessments for specific products/services
- **Product Information Collection**: Name, description, revenue data
- **Assessment Initiation**: Start product-specific S2D evaluation

### 7.2 Product Service Assessment Form (`ProductServiceAssessmentForm.jsx`)
- **Dedicated S2D Form**: Specialized form for product/service assessment
- **Product Context**: Assessment questions tailored to specific offerings
- **Results Integration**: Seamless connection to S2D results display

## 8. Communication Features

### 8.1 Request New Link (`RequestNewLink.jsx`)
- **Email Link Generation**: Request new assessment links via email
- **User Communication**: Resend integration for email delivery
- **Assessment Recovery**: Help users regain access to assessments

### 8.2 Admin Features
- **Submission Management**: Admin interface for viewing submissions (`AdminSubmissionsPage.jsx`)
- **Assessment Oversight**: Administrative tools for assessment management

## 9. Utility Functions

### 9.1 Question Helpers (`questionHelpers.js`)
- **Dynamic Question Logic**: Helper functions for conditional questions
- **Channel-Specific Processing**: Marketing channel-specific question handling
- **Form Data Processing**: Utilities for form data manipulation

### 9.2 URL Helpers (`urlHelpers.js`)
- **Function URL Management**: Helper functions for API endpoint management
- **Environment Configuration**: URL configuration for different environments

## 10. Data Models and Structure

### 10.1 Questions Data (`questions.js`)
- **13 Assessment Sections**: Complete question database for all assessment areas
- **Scoring Integration**: Questions linked to scoring algorithms
- **Industry Context**: Industry-specific question variations
- **Validation Rules**: Required fields and validation logic

### 10.2 Section Data Modules
- **Profile Questions**: Basic business information collection
- **S2D Questions**: Sale to delivery process assessment
- **D2S Questions**: Delivery to success evaluation
- **M2L Questions**: Market to lead assessment (2 parts)

## 11. Deployment and Infrastructure

### 11.1 Netlify Integration
- **Static Site Deployment**: Optimized for Netlify deployment
- **Environment Configuration**: Production environment setup
- **Build Optimization**: Vite-based build process

### 11.2 Supabase Backend
- **Authentication Service**: User management and authentication
- **Database Storage**: PostgreSQL database for assessments
- **Real-time Features**: Real-time data synchronization capabilities

## Key Strengths of Current Implementation

1. **Comprehensive Assessment Engine**: Covers all major business valuation factors
2. **Modular Architecture**: Well-organized, maintainable code structure
3. **User Experience**: Intuitive multi-step process with progress tracking
4. **Data Persistence**: Robust form state management and recovery
5. **Industry Specificity**: NAICS integration and industry-specific adjustments
6. **Scoring Sophistication**: Multi-dimensional scoring with weighted factors
7. **Results Visualization**: Clear, actionable reporting and analysis
8. **Product-Specific Assessments**: Granular evaluation of individual offerings
9. **Authentication Security**: Secure user management with Supabase
10. **Responsive Design**: Modern, responsive user interface

<?php

namespace App\Models;

// use Illuminate\Contracts\Auth\MustVerifyEmail;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Factories\HasFactory;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Relations\HasMany;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Relations\HasOne;
use Illuminate\Foundation\Auth\User as Authenticatable;
use Illuminate\Notifications\Notifiable;

class User extends Authenticatable
{
    /** @use HasFactory<\Database\Factories\UserFactory> */
    use HasFactory, Notifiable;

    /**
     * The attributes that are mass assignable.
     *
     * @var list<string>
     */
    protected $fillable = [
        'name',
        'email',
        'password',
    ];

    /**
     * The attributes that should be hidden for serialization.
     *
     * @var list<string>
     */
    protected $hidden = [
        'password',
        'remember_token',
    ];

    /**
     * Get the attributes that should be cast.
     *
     * @return array<string, string>
     */
    protected function casts(): array
    {
        return [
            'email_verified_at' => 'datetime:M j, Y - H:i:s',
            'password' => 'hashed',
            'created_at' => 'datetime:M j, Y - H:i:s',
            'updated_at' => 'datetime:M j, Y - H:i:s',
        ];
    }

    /**
     * Get all assessments for this user.
     */
    public function assessments(): HasMany
    {
        return $this->hasMany(UserAssessment::class);
    }

    /**
     * Get the progress record for this user.
     */
    public function assessmentProgress(): HasOne
    {
        return $this->hasOne(UserAssessmentProgress::class);
    }
}

<?php

namespace App\Models;

use App\Enums\DiagramStatus;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Factories\HasFactory;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Model;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Relations\BelongsTo;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Relations\HasMany;

class Diagram extends Model
{
    use HasFactory;

    protected $fillable = [
        'name',
        'description',
        'status',
        'version',
        'process_id',
        'user_id',
        'owner',
    ];

    protected $casts = [
        'status' => DiagramStatus::class,
    ];

    protected $appends = ['formatted_created_at', 'formatted_updated_at'];

    public function getFormattedCreatedAtAttribute()
    {
        return $this->created_at ? $this->created_at->format('M j, Y - H:i:s') : null;
    }

    public function getFormattedUpdatedAtAttribute()
    {
        return $this->updated_at ? $this->updated_at->format('M j, Y - H:i:s') : null;
    }

    public function toArray()
    {
        $array = parent::toArray();
        $array['created_at'] = $this->getFormattedCreatedAtAttribute();
        $array['updated_at'] = $this->getFormattedUpdatedAtAttribute();
        return $array;
    }

    public function process(): BelongsTo
    {
        return $this->belongsTo(Process::class);
    }

    public function user(): BelongsTo
    {
        return $this->belongsTo(User::class);
    }

    public function activities(): HasMany
    {
        return $this->hasMany(Activity::class)->orderBy('position');
    }

    /**
     * Generates Mermaid diagram code based on the diagram's activities.
     *
     * @return string The generated Mermaid code.
     */
    public function generateMermaidCode(): string
    {
        $mermaidCode = "flowchart TD\n";
        // Load activities with SOP relationships for status indicators
        $activities = $this->activities()->with(['sop.versions' => function ($query) {
            $query->orderBy('version_number', 'desc');
        }])->get();

        $currentActivities = $activities->where('current_future', 0)->values(); // 0 for Current
        $futureActivities = $activities->where('current_future', 1)->values();  // 1 for Future

        $nodeCounter = 1; // To ensure unique node IDs

        if ($currentActivities->isNotEmpty()) {
            $mermaidCode .= "    subgraph Current [\"Current Activities\"]\n";
            foreach ($currentActivities as $index => $activity) {
                $activityId = 'C' . $nodeCounter++;

                // Get SOP status indicator
                $sopIndicator = $this->getSopIndicatorForActivity($activity);

                $raciParts = [];
                if ($activity->responsible) $raciParts[] = "R.: " . $activity->responsible;
                if ($activity->accountable) $raciParts[] = "A.: " . $activity->accountable;
                if ($activity->consulted) $raciParts[] = "C.: " . $activity->consulted;
                if ($activity->informed)  $raciParts[] = "I.: " . $activity->informed;
                $raciText = !empty($raciParts) ? " | " . implode(" | ", $raciParts) : '';

                // Include SOP indicator in the node text
                $nodeText = $activity->name . $sopIndicator . $raciText;
                $mermaidCode .= sprintf("        %s[\"%s\"]\n", $activityId, addslashes($nodeText));

                if ($index < $currentActivities->count() - 1) {
                    $nextActivityId = 'C' . $nodeCounter; // ID of the next node in this subgraph
                    $mermaidCode .= sprintf("        %s --> %s\n", $activityId, $nextActivityId);
                }
            }
            $mermaidCode .= "    end\n\n";
        }

        $nodeCounter = 1; // Reset for future activities to keep IDs like F1, F2
        if ($futureActivities->isNotEmpty()) {
            $mermaidCode .= "    subgraph Future [\"Future Activities\"]\n";
            foreach ($futureActivities as $index => $activity) {
                $activityId = 'F' . $nodeCounter++;

                // Get SOP status indicator
                $sopIndicator = $this->getSopIndicatorForActivity($activity);

                $raciParts = [];
                if ($activity->responsible) $raciParts[] = "R.: " . $activity->responsible;
                if ($activity->accountable) $raciParts[] = "A.: " . $activity->accountable;
                if ($activity->consulted) $raciParts[] = "C.: " . $activity->consulted;
                if ($activity->informed)  $raciParts[] = "I.: " . $activity->informed;
                $raciText = !empty($raciParts) ? " | " . implode(" | ", $raciParts) : '';

                // Include SOP indicator in the node text
                $nodeText = $activity->name . $sopIndicator . $raciText;
                $mermaidCode .= sprintf("        %s[\"%s\"]\n", $activityId, addslashes($nodeText));

                if ($index < $futureActivities->count() - 1) {
                    $nextActivityId = 'F' . $nodeCounter; // ID of the next node in this subgraph
                    $mermaidCode .= sprintf("        %s --> %s\n", $activityId, $nextActivityId);
                }
            }
            $mermaidCode .= "    end\n";
        }

        if ($currentActivities->isNotEmpty() && $futureActivities->isNotEmpty()) {
            // Connect last current to first future if both exist. Need their IDs.
            // This is a simplification; you might want more complex inter-subgraph logic.
            $lastCurrentActivityId = 'C' . ($currentActivities->count()); // This assumes sequential C1, C2...
            $firstFutureActivityId = 'F1';
            $mermaidCode .= sprintf("    %s --> %s\n", $lastCurrentActivityId, $firstFutureActivityId);
        }

        return $mermaidCode;
    }

    /**
     * Get SOP status indicator for an activity to display in Mermaid diagram.
     */
    private function getSopIndicatorForActivity($activity): string
    {
        if (!$activity->sop || $activity->sop->is_archived) {
            return ' [No SOP]';
        }

        $sop = $activity->sop;
        $currentVersion = $sop->getCurrentVersion();

        if ($currentVersion) {
            return ' [SOP ‚úì]';
        }

        $latestVersion = $sop->getLatestVersion();
        if ($latestVersion) {
            switch ($latestVersion->status->value) {
                case 0: // WIP
                    return ' [SOP ‚è≥]';
                case 2: // Future
                    return ' [SOP üìã]';
                default:
                    return ' [SOP ?]';
            }
        }

        return ' [SOP ?]';
    }
}

<?php

namespace App\Models;

use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Factories\HasFactory;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Model;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Relations\BelongsTo;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Relations\HasMany;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Relations\HasOne;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Relations\HasManyThrough;

class Activity extends Model
{
    use HasFactory;

    protected $fillable = [
        'name',
        'description',
        'type',
        'diagram_id',
        'position',
        'current_future',
        'responsible',
        'accountable',
        'consulted',
        'informed',
        'process_link',
    ];

    protected $casts = [
        'position' => 'integer',
        'current_future' => 'integer',
    ];

    protected $appends = ['formatted_created_at', 'formatted_updated_at'];

    public function getFormattedCreatedAtAttribute()
    {
        return $this->created_at ? $this->created_at->format('M j, Y - H:i:s') : null;
    }

    public function getFormattedUpdatedAtAttribute()
    {
        return $this->updated_at ? $this->updated_at->format('M j, Y - H:i:s') : null;
    }

    public function toArray()
    {
        $array = parent::toArray();
        $array['created_at'] = $this->getFormattedCreatedAtAttribute();
        $array['updated_at'] = $this->getFormattedUpdatedAtAttribute();
        return $array;
    }

    /**
     * The "booted" method of the model.
     */
    protected static function booted(): void
    {
        // Touch the parent diagram whenever an activity is created, updated, or deleted
        static::created(function (Activity $activity) {
            $activity->diagram?->touch();
        });

        static::updated(function (Activity $activity) {
            $activity->diagram?->touch();
        });

        static::deleted(function (Activity $activity) {
            $activity->diagram?->touch();
        });
    }

    public function diagram(): BelongsTo
    {
        return $this->belongsTo(Diagram::class);
    }

    public function sop(): HasOne
    {
        return $this->hasOne(SOP::class);
    }

    // For backward compatibility - returns collection with single SOP
    public function sops(): HasMany
    {
        return $this->hasMany(SOP::class);
    }

    public function currentSOPVersion()
    {
        return $this->sop?->getCurrentVersion();
    }

    public function sopVersions(): HasManyThrough
    {
        return $this->hasManyThrough(SOPVersion::class, SOP::class, 'activity_id', 'sop_id')
            ->orderBy('version_number', 'desc');
    }
}

<?php

use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Route;
use Inertia\Inertia;
use App\Http\Controllers\ProcessDiagramController;
use App\Http\Controllers\DashboardController;
use App\Http\Controllers\BusinessProcessController;
use App\Http\Controllers\CategoryController;
use App\Http\Controllers\SOPController;
use App\Http\Controllers\AssessmentController;
use App\Http\Controllers\AssessmentFormController;
use App\Http\Controllers\ResultsController;

Route::get('/', function () {
    return redirect()->route('dashboard');
})->name('home');

// Public API endpoints (no auth required)
Route::get('/api/naics-subsectors/{sector_id}', [AssessmentFormController::class, 'getNaicsSubsectors'])
    ->where('sector_id', '[0-9]+')
    ->name('api.naics-subsectors');

Route::middleware(['auth', 'verified'])->group(function () {
    Route::get('dashboard', [DashboardController::class, 'index'])->name('dashboard');
    Route::get('business-processes', [BusinessProcessController::class, 'index'])->name('business-processes');

    // Assessment Routes Group
    Route::prefix('assessments')->name('assessments.')->group(function () {
        // Main assessment dashboard
        Route::get('/', [AssessmentController::class, 'index'])->name('index');

        // Assessment management
        Route::post('/', [AssessmentController::class, 'store'])->name('store');
        Route::get('/templates', [AssessmentController::class, 'templates'])->name('templates');
        Route::get('/stats', [AssessmentController::class, 'stats'])->name('stats');
        Route::get('/next-recommended', [AssessmentController::class, 'nextRecommended'])->name('next-recommended');

        // Individual assessment routes by slug
        Route::get('/{slug}', [AssessmentController::class, 'show'])->name('show')
            ->where('slug', 'profile|s2d|d2s|m2l-channels|m2l-process|expansion|marketing|profitability|offering-sales|workforce|systems|market-position|financials');

        // Assessment form routes
        Route::prefix('form')->name('form.')->group(function () {
            Route::get('/{slug}', [AssessmentFormController::class, 'show'])->name('show')
                ->where('slug', 'profile|s2d|d2s|m2l-channels|m2l-process|expansion|marketing|profitability|offering-sales|workforce|systems|market-position|financials');
            Route::put('/{slug}', [AssessmentFormController::class, 'update'])->name('update')
                ->where('slug', 'profile|s2d|d2s|m2l-channels|m2l-process|expansion|marketing|profitability|offering-sales|workforce|systems|market-position|financials');
            Route::post('/{slug}/validate', [AssessmentFormController::class, 'validateAnswers'])->name('validate')
                ->where('slug', 'profile|s2d|d2s|m2l-channels|m2l-process|expansion|marketing|profitability|offering-sales|workforce|systems|market-position|financials');
            Route::get('/{slug}/progress', [AssessmentFormController::class, 'getProgress'])->name('progress')
                ->where('slug', 'profile|s2d|d2s|m2l-channels|m2l-process|expansion|marketing|profitability|offering-sales|workforce|systems|market-position|financials');
        });

        // Assessment form route (simplified)
        Route::get('/form/{slug}', [AssessmentFormController::class, 'show'])->name('form')
            ->where('slug', 'profile|s2d|d2s|m2l-channels|m2l-process|expansion|marketing|profitability|offering-sales|workforce|systems|market-position|financials');

        // Assessment CRUD operations
        Route::put('/{id}', [AssessmentController::class, 'update'])->name('update')->where('id', '[0-9]+');
        Route::post('/{id}/complete', [AssessmentController::class, 'complete'])->name('complete')->where('id', '[0-9]+');
        Route::delete('/{id}', [AssessmentController::class, 'destroy'])->name('destroy')->where('id', '[0-9]+');

        // Dependent options (NAICS subsectors, etc.)
        Route::post('/dependent-options', [AssessmentFormController::class, 'getDependentOptions'])->name('dependent-options');

        // Results routes
        Route::prefix('results')->name('results.')->group(function () {
            Route::get('/', [ResultsController::class, 'index'])->name('index');
            Route::get('/global', [ResultsController::class, 'global'])->name('global');
            Route::get('/charts', [ResultsController::class, 'charts'])->name('charts');
            Route::get('/valuation', [ResultsController::class, 'valuation'])->name('valuation');
            Route::get('/recommendations', [ResultsController::class, 'recommendations'])->name('recommendations');
            Route::get('/export', [ResultsController::class, 'export'])->name('export');
            Route::get('/pdf', [ResultsController::class, 'pdf'])->name('pdf');
            Route::get('/{slug}', [ResultsController::class, 'show'])->name('show')
                ->where('slug', 'profile|s2d|d2s|m2l-channels|m2l-process|expansion|marketing|profitability|offering-sales|workforce|systems|market-position|financials');
        });
    });

    // Category routes
    Route::get('/categories/{category}', [CategoryController::class, 'show'])->name('categories.show');

    Route::get('/processes/{process}/diagrams', [ProcessDiagramController::class, 'index'])->name('processes.diagrams.index');
    Route::post('/processes/{process}/diagrams', [ProcessDiagramController::class, 'store'])->name('processes.diagrams.store');
    Route::get('/diagram/{diagram}', [ProcessDiagramController::class, 'show'])->name('diagram.show');
    Route::put('/diagrams/{diagram}', [ProcessDiagramController::class, 'update'])->name('diagrams.update');
    Route::delete('/diagrams/{diagram}', [ProcessDiagramController::class, 'destroy'])->name('diagrams.destroy');

    Route::resource('processes.diagrams', ProcessDiagramController::class)
        ->except(['edit', 'create']);

    Route::post('processes/{process}/diagrams/{diagram}/activities', [ProcessDiagramController::class, 'storeActivity'])
        ->name('diagrams.activities.store');

    Route::put('activities/{activity}', [ProcessDiagramController::class, 'updateActivity'])->name('diagrams.activities.update');

    Route::delete('activities/{activity}', [ProcessDiagramController::class, 'deleteActivity'])->name('diagrams.activities.destroy');

    Route::put('diagrams/{diagram}/activities/reorder', [ProcessDiagramController::class, 'reorderActivities'])->name('diagrams.activities.reorder');

    // Route for parsing HTML content
    Route::post('diagrams/{diagram}/parse-html', [ProcessDiagramController::class, 'parseHtml'])->name('diagrams.parse-html');

    // SOP routes
    Route::resource('sops', SOPController::class)->except(['show', 'edit', 'update', 'create']);

    // SOP version routes
    Route::get('sops/{sop}', [SOPController::class, 'show'])->name('sops.show');
    Route::get('sops/{sop}/versions/{version}', [SOPController::class, 'show'])->name('sops.versions.show');
    // Edit routes removed - using inline editing on show page
    Route::put('sops/{sop}', [SOPController::class, 'update'])->name('sops.update');
    Route::put('sops/{sop}/versions/{version}', [SOPController::class, 'update'])->name('sops.versions.update');

    // Working copy routes for new versioning system
    Route::put('sops/{sop}/save', [SOPController::class, 'save'])->name('sops.save');
    Route::put('sops/{sop}/versions/{version}/save', [SOPController::class, 'saveVersion'])->name('sops.versions.save');
    Route::put('sops/{sop}/commit', [SOPController::class, 'commit'])->name('sops.commit');

    // SOP version comparison and status
    Route::get('sops/{sop}/compare/{versionA}/{versionB}', [SOPController::class, 'compare'])->name('sops.compare');
    Route::put('sops/{sop}/versions/{version}/status', [SOPController::class, 'updateStatus'])->name('sops.versions.update-status');

    // SOP archive/restore (applies to entire SOP)
    Route::post('sops/{sop}/archive', [SOPController::class, 'archive'])->name('sops.archive');
    Route::post('sops/{sop}/restore', [SOPController::class, 'restore'])->name('sops.restore');
});

require __DIR__.'/settings.php';
require __DIR__.'/auth.php';

content.text:
Welcome to the **Business Process Framework** project! This is a comprehensive business process management application built with modern technologies. Here's your onboarding guide:

## üéØ Project Overview

This Laravel-based application helps organizations map, visualize, and manage their business processes using the RACI (Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed) responsibility matrix framework. The project combines business process management with business assessment capabilities.

## üõ† Tech Stack

**Backend:**
- Laravel 12 with PHP 8.2+
- Inertia.js 2.0 for SPA experience
- SQLite database (default)

**Frontend:**
- React 19 with TypeScript 5.7
- Tailwind CSS 4.0 + shadcn/ui components
- Vite 6.0 for build tooling

## üèó Core Architecture

### Database Models (app/Models/)
- **User** - Authentication and user management
- **Category** - Process organization (Strategic, Core, Enabling)
- **Process** - Individual business processes
- **Diagram** - Visual process representations with Mermaid integration
- **Activity** - Process steps with RACI assignments
- **SOP/SOPVersion** - Standard Operating Procedures with versioning
- **Assessment Models** - Business valuation assessment system

### Controllers (app/Http/Controllers/)
- **ProcessDiagramController** - Main process/diagram management
- **AssessmentController** - Business assessment system
- **SOPController** - Document management
- **CategoryController** - Process categorization

### Frontend Structure (resources/js/)
- **components/** - Reusable UI components with shadcn/ui
- **pages/** - Page components for routing
- **layouts/** - Layout templates
- **hooks/** - Custom React hooks
- **lib/** - Utility functions and configs

## üîë Key Features

### Process Management
- **RACI Matrix** - Responsibility assignment for activities
- **Drag & Drop** - Intuitive activity reordering
- **Mermaid Diagrams** - Visual process flow generation
- **SOP Integration** - Document management with versioning

### Assessment System
- **13-Step Business Evaluation** covering:
  - Profile, S2D/D2S processes
  - Market analysis, expansion capability
  - Financial metrics and workforce assessment
- **NAICS Industry Classification**
- **Scoring and Valuation Algorithms**
- **Results Visualization** with charts

### Development Features
- **Comprehensive Testing** - Unit, Feature, and Browser tests using Pest
- **Type Safety** - Full TypeScript integration
- **Modern UI** - Dark mode, responsive design
- **Real-time Updates** - Seamless data synchronization

## üöÄ Getting Started

```bash
# Install dependencies
composer install
pnpm install

# Setup environment
cp .env.example .env
php artisan key:generate
touch database/database.sqlite
php artisan migrate --seed

# Development
composer run dev  # Starts all services (server, queue, logs, vite)
```

## üìÅ Navigation Tips

- **Main dashboard**: `resources/js/pages/dashboard.tsx`
- **Process diagrams**: `resources/js/pages/processes/diagrams/`
- **Assessment forms**: `resources/js/pages/assessments/`
- **API routes**: `routes/web.php` (lines 28-78 for assessments)
- **Database**: Check `database/migrations/` for schema

## üß™ Testing

```bash
php artisan test        # Backend tests
pnpm run test          # Frontend tests
```

The project has excellent test coverage including unit tests, feature tests, and browser automation tests.

## üé® UI Components

Uses shadcn/ui component library with custom components in `resources/js/components/ui/`. The design system supports dark mode and is fully responsive.

You're now ready to contribute! The codebase follows Laravel conventions with modern React patterns. Check the README.md for detailed setup instructions and the current-features.md for a comprehensive feature overview.

## Technical Summary

**Architecture**: Laravel 12 + Inertia.js SPA with React 19/TypeScript frontend

**Stack**:
- Backend: PHP 8.2, Laravel 12, SQLite
- Frontend: React 19, TypeScript 5.7, Tailwind CSS 4.0, Vite 6.0
- UI: shadcn/ui components, Lucide icons
- Testing: Pest (PHP), Jest (JS)

**Core Models**: User ‚Üí Category ‚Üí Process ‚Üí Diagram ‚Üí Activity (with RACI matrix), SOP versioning system, Assessment templates

**Key Controllers**: ProcessDiagramController, AssessmentController, SOPController managing CRUD + business logic

**Features**:
- Business process mapping with RACI responsibility matrix
- Mermaid diagram generation from activities
- 13-step business assessment system with NAICS classification
- SOP document management with versioning
- Drag-and-drop activity reordering
- Real-time updates via Inertia

**Frontend Structure**: Pages/components pattern, custom hooks, layout templates, assessment form system with dynamic question rendering

**Testing**: Comprehensive coverage - Unit/Feature/Browser tests, 90%+ backend coverage

**Development**: `composer run dev` starts concurrent Laravel server, queue worker, logs, and Vite dev server

**Database**: 40+ migrations including assessment questions, NAICS data, user progress tracking

**Authentication**: Laravel Breeze with policy-based authorization, user isolation for all resources
